DOC.brief_summary: The aim study compare successful spinal puncture among patient pendant position comparison use traditional sit position caesarean section .
DOC.brief_title: Pendant Position Traditional Sitting Position Successful Spinal Puncture Spinal Anaesthesia
DOC.detailed_description: Approval Ethical Committee Faculty Medicine University Indonesia acquire prior conduct study . Subjects give informed consent enrol study . Subjects divide Group A traditional sit position ( n=154 ) Group B pendant position ( n=154 ) . The outcome parameter record number attempt successful spinal puncture , number spinal needle-bone contact duration perform spinal puncture . Data analyze use Statistical Package Social Scientist ( SPSS ) version 21.0 . Numerical data serve median minimal maximal value . Numerical data analyze use Mann-Whitney test . Categorical data serve use relative risk ( RR ) 95 % confidence interval ( 95 % CI ) analyze use Chi-Square test .
DOC.criteria: pregnant woman age 1845 year old Body Mass Index ( BMI ) 1835 kg/m2 physical status American Society Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) IIII plan undergo cesarean section spinal anesthesia sign informed consent form Patients contraindication spinal anesthesia ( infection injection site , coagulation disorder , severe hypovolemia , increase intracranial pressure , aortic and/or mitral stenosis ) pregnancy head entrapment fetus , umbilical cord prolapse , foot presentation , Patient eclampsia Patient cardiovascular disease Patient scoliosis Patient history lumbar surgery Patient unpalpable intervertebral space due thick fatty tissue edema . Drop criterion : spinal block fail partial block
DOC.keyword: spinal , anesthesia , pendant , spinal-bone contact , puncture
